title.narrative: EMERGENCY RESPONSE

description.narrative: Staff Cost (Technical Suppoprt), which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, UNICEF, Government and key humanitarian partners effectively analyze, prepare and coordinate emergency response to children and families at risk and in humanitarian situations, especially those most vulnerable.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Staff Cost (Technical Suppoprt)

description.narrative: UNICEF’s response to communities facing critical humanitarian situations has continued to be strongly supported by the field operations team. The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic continued to be felt while the camp closure programme on the federal side was almost completed. The UNICEF team responded to the return of families from the Al Hol camp in Syria, setting up quality child protection, education and WASH services in the Jeddah 1 camps. The winterization campaign of 2020-21 was completed and preparations made for further distribution of winter clothing to the most vulnerable children made in time for the winter season 2021-22. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
